", 'number': 47}, {'created': '2015-07-24 00:18:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Volume status management during migration

The initial migration_status is None, meaning no migration has been
done. Migration_status 'error' means the previous migration failed.
Migration_status 'success' means the previous migration succeeded.

If the key 'force' flag is set to True from the request, the volume
status should be set to 'maintenance' during migration and goes
back to its original status after migration. Otherwise, if the
key 'force' is set to False, the volume status will remain the
same as its original status.

All the actions, including attach, detach, etc, are not allowed
when the volume is in 'maintenance' mode. If it is not in maintenance
mode, the migration can be interrupted if other requests
are issued, e.g. attach. For the termination of migration, another
patch will target to resolve it.

DocImpact
APIImpact The key 'force' has been added into the API, telling the
volume to change the status to 'maintenance' or not.

Change-Id: Ia86421f2d6fce61dcfeb073f8e7b9c9dde517373

", 'number': 50}, {'created': '2015-07-29 07:25:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Volume status management during migration

The initial migration_status is None, meaning no migration has been
done. Migration_status 'error' means the previous migration failed.
Migration_status 'success' means the previous migration succeeded.

If the key 'force' is set to True from the request, the volume
status should be set to 'maintenance' during migration and goes
back to its original status after migration. Otherwise, if the
key 'force' is set to False, the volume status will remain the
same as its original status.

From the REST's perspetives, all the create, update and delete
actions are not allowed if the volume is in 'maintenance', because
it means the volume out of service. If it is not in maintenance
mode, the migration can be interrupted if other requests are
issued, e.g. attach. For the termination of migration, another
patch will target to resolve it.

DocImpact
APIImpact The key 'force' has been added into the API, telling the
volume to change the status to 'maintenance' or not.

", 'number': 52}, {'created': '2015-07-30 06:59:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Volume status management during migration

The initial migration_status is None, meaning no migration has been
done. Migration_status 'error' means the previous migration failed.
Migration_status 'success' means the previous migration succeeded.

If the key 'lock_volume' is set to True from the request, the volume
status should be set to 'maintenance' during migration and goes
back to its original status after migration. Otherwise, if the
key 'force' is set to False, the volume status will remain the
same as its original status.

From the REST's perspetives, all the create, update and delete
actions are not allowed if the volume is in 'maintenance', because
it means the volume out of service. If it is not in maintenance
mode, the migration can be interrupted if other requests are
issued, e.g. attach. For the termination of migration, another
patch will target to resolve it.

DocImpact
APIImpact The key 'lock_volume' has been added into the API,
telling the volume to change the status to 'maintenance' or not.

Change-Id: Ia86421f2d6fce61dcfeb073f8e7b9c9dde517373

", 'number': 58}, {'created': '2015-08-06 10:11:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Volume status management during migration

The initial migration_status is None, meaning no migration has been
done. Migration_status 'error' means the previous migration failed.
Migration_status 'success' means the previous migration succeeded.

If the key 'lock_volume' is set to True from the request, the volume
status should be set to 'maintenance' during migration and goes
back to its original status after migration. Otherwise, if the
key 'lock_volume' is set to False, the volume status will remain the
same as its original status.

From the REST's perspetives, all the create, update and delete
actions are not allowed if the volume is in 'maintenance', because
it means the volume out of service. If it is not in maintenance
mode, the migration can be interrupted if other requests are
issued, e.g. attach. For the termination of migration, another
patch will target to resolve it.

DocImpact
APIImpact The key 'lock_volume' has been added into the API,
telling the volume to change the status to 'maintenance' or not.

If the key 'lock_volume' is set to True from the request, the volume
status should be set to 'maintenance' during migration and goes
back to its original status after migration. Otherwise, if the
key 'lock_volume' is set to False, the volume status will remain the
same as its original status.

From the REST's perspectives, all the create, update and delete
actions are not allowed if the volume is in 'maintenance', because
it means the volume out of service. If it is not in maintenance
mode, the migration can be interrupted if other requests are
issued, e.g. attach. For the termination of migration, another
patch will target to resolve it.

DocImpact
APIImpact The key 'lock_volume' has been added into the API,
telling the volume to change the status to 'maintenance' or not.

commit_message:
Volume status management during migration

This patch proposes a new implementation for the status and
the migration_status for volumes.

* The initial migration_status is None, meaning no migration has been
done; Migration_status 'error' means the previous migration failed.
Migration_status 'success' means the previous migration succeeded.

* If the key 'lock_volume' is set to True from the request, the volume
status should be set to 'maintenance' during migration and goes
back to its original status after migration. Otherwise, if the
key 'lock_volume' is set to False, the volume status will remain the
same as its original status. The default value for lock_volume is
False and it applies to the available volume.

* From the REST's perspectives, all the create, update and delete
actions are not allowed if the volume is in 'maintenance', because
it means the volume is out of service. If it is not in maintenance
mode, the migration can be interrupted if other requests are
issued, e.g. attach. For the termination of migration, another
patch will target to resolve it.

DocImpact
APIImpact The key 'lock_volume' has been added into the API,
telling the volume to change the status to 'maintenance' or not.
The migration_status has been added into results returned
from volume list command, if the request is from an admin.

Change-Id: Ia86421f2d6fce61dcfeb073f8e7b9c9dde517373
Partial-implements: blueprint migration-improvement

commit_message:
Auto assign nic for servers context

Servers context now uses nova scenarios's _boot_servers. Enable
auto_assign_nic in servers context could avoid "Multiple possible
networks found" error from Nova.

Change-Id: I15a4f1595344331971078cb1e4f17162e764ac8e
Closes-Bug: #1477583

commit_message:
Fix gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-barbicanclient gate

Gate continues to fail due to the following error:
[ERROR] /opt/stack/new/devstack/inc/python:178 The following
LIBS_FROM_GIT were not installed correct: python-barbicanclient

This patch changes the pre-test hook to install the
python-barbican client from git before the tests are run.

Change-Id: I1ef957a8a85e0762cc90b3aab7299ed9bec86e23

commit_message:
Fix adding tap failure if bridge mapping is not provided

When bridge mapping option is not provided, tap interface cannot be
added properly. The root cause is that linux bridge agent is expecting
bridge mapping option is provided if physical network is presented.

However it is not always the case as Kilo was working fine
without existing bridge mapping

Change-Id: Ie43905887a9bc60858e3edae7fc339a7e0485716
Closes-bug: #1495161

subject: Make nodepool dsvm non-voting
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-21 23:27:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make nodepool dsvm experimental

This job is not very reliable yet, so should not be voting.

It also takes significantly longer than other nodepool tests and
is not needed for most nodepool changes.  It is good to be able to
validate nodepool's behavior against a running OpenStack cloud, but
nodepool itself does not change the behavior of the cloud like
the OpenStack components in devstack.  Nor does it rely heavily on
OpenStack features -- instead, it uses a very simple set of API calls
that are well-mocked in nodepool.

Add it to the experimental pipeline so it is easily available to test
changes that alter our use of the OpenStack API.

Change-Id: Id92cb0b3adcfc8fa4db969b5a53bdf8fac49ab7f
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-21 23:59:51.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make nodepool dsvm experimental

This job can fail due to external factors, so make it non-voting.

Change-Id: Id92cb0b3adcfc8fa4db969b5a53bdf8fac49ab7f
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-09-22 00:00:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make nodepool dsvm non-voting

commit_message:
Make nodepool dsvm non-voting

This job can fail due to external factors, so make it non-voting.

Change-Id: Id92cb0b3adcfc8fa4db969b5a53bdf8fac49ab7f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-24 13:09:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add pagination to snapshots

Currently snapshot list does not provide pagination like volume does.

This patch adds simple pagination feature using existing API parameters.
Which means it doesn't allow marker optional argument.

It uses already existing limit and offset parameters to generate the
next link and it is returned in the same way as volume does: {
'snapshots': [...], 'snapshots_links': [{'rel': 'next', 'href':
'http...'}]}

Since pagination's slicing is done at API level instead of at DB level,
same as it was done before this patch when using limit and reaching
osapi_max_limit, this is as efficient as it could be, but that will be
left for another patch.

Snapshots need refactoring to use _view_builder like the rest of the
resources do, but again, that should be for another patch.

DocImpact
APIImpact
Change-Id: I21edac6d29abf7fc2f446111a7d6888db9ab6eba

commit_message:
Add pagination to snapshots

Currently snapshot list does not provide pagination like volume does.

This patch adds pagination for snapshots in the same way that volume
does, using marker, limit, sort_keys and sort_dirs.

DocImpact
APIImpact: Use marker, limit, sort_keys and sort_dirs
Implements: snapshots-and-bakcup-support-pagination-query
Implements: blueprint extend-limit-implementations
Change-Id: I21edac6d29abf7fc2f446111a7d6888db9ab6eba

commit_message:
resource failure causes nested stacks to be rolled back

an update_cancel RPC call for a nested stacks whenever an update
operation was cancelled in the parent stack.Unfortunately this always
triggers a rollback.
In this change, resource failure with nested stacks will cancel any
in-progress update but not roll back by default (roll back only when
rollblack cancel exception raised).
The Operator can retry in this way without waiting for timeout
or overall roll back occurred.

Change-Id: I94d75a21367f39c17a9b40b5d23405a28873cd1a
Closes-Bug: #1475057
(cherry picked from commit b76f6ec0e97a9c3aaf5b5140e7a449c9636b8f95)

subject: Cancel nested stack updates when appropriate
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-21 01:35:04.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py'], 'message': 'Cancel nested stack updates when appropriate

If a stack update is cancelled while the update of a nested stack is being
processed, the nested stack update is no longer stopped since the
implementation changed in Kilo to use the RPC API to control nested stacks.

To alleviate this, use the RPC API to cancel the (nested) stack update when
the resource update is cancelled. This results in a rollback of the nested
stack, so if a subsequent attempt to roll back the ensted stack by doing a
stack update fails due to the rollback already being in progress, just
ignore the error and wait for the existing operation to complete.

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py

Change-Id: I3eacf216194517c995732a3f4de876551b70fe91
Closes-Bug: #1446252
(cherry picked from commit ad4c00e672fdd2c1c8461d7e4813dff4b093ae0f)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Cancel nested stack updates when appropriate

If a stack update is cancelled while the update of a nested stack is being
processed, the nested stack update is no longer stopped since the
implementation changed in Kilo to use the RPC API to control nested stacks.

To alleviate this, use the RPC API to cancel the (nested) stack update when
the resource update is cancelled. This results in a rollback of the nested
stack, so if a subsequent attempt to roll back the ensted stack by doing a
stack update fails due to the rollback already being in progress, just
ignore the error and wait for the existing operation to complete.

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/stack_resource.py

Change-Id: I3eacf216194517c995732a3f4de876551b70fe91
Closes-Bug: #1446252
(cherry picked from commit ad4c00e672fdd2c1c8461d7e4813dff4b093ae0f)

commit_message:
claims: move a debug msg to a warn on missing migration

We want to log a warning when there is a missing migration record when
creating a migration_context record, because it's most likely caused by
either a misconfiguration or a bug. We made it a debug message in the
original patch as the rules for translated strings were unclear at the
time, but now we can do it - so let's do it!

Change-Id: I440e357f8eeacae2972c74aa7be15d689fb9ac64

[{'created': '2015-08-31 19:03:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hyperv/vmutilsv2.py', 'nova/virt/hyperv/vmutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutils.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/hyperv/test_vmutilsv2.py'], 'message': 'Hyper-V: Fixes serial port issue on Windows Threshold

VM serial ports.

For this reason, attempting to retrieve serial port connections

This patch fixes the issue by adding an extra check and using the
right WMI class in order to retrieve VM serial ports.

Change-Id: Ibaf6ac2e77b6324538c6f3dbaacab2a5f065b4ce

(cherry picked from commit b645a752707dffbfce97a39c456509439614f3b6)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Hyper-V: Fixes serial port issue on Windows Threshold

On Windows Threshold, a new WMI class was introduced, targeting
VM serial ports.

For this reason, attempting to retrieve serial port connections
fails on Windows Threshold.

This patch fixes the issue by adding an extra check and using the
right WMI class in order to retrieve VM serial ports.

Change-Id: Ibaf6ac2e77b6324538c6f3dbaacab2a5f065b4ce
Closes-Bug: #1466056
(cherry picked from commit b645a752707dffbfce97a39c456509439614f3b6)

commit_message:
Prepare tempest job for ironic-lib

ironic-lib will soon become a dependency of ironic. To avoid future
breakages we decided to act in advance, and prepare a dsvm job for it.

Non-voting for now, will make voting as soon as it proves working.

Depends-On: I6e66ae770cf5065980848e7e987bfd75765a5ac6
Change-Id: Icb7a02b3dd76a1e1663b73855f39895cb2ee5db6

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-21 12:39:02.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a non-voting gate-barbican-python34 check job

Barbican has a py34 test environment in tox.ini, but no check job
associated job. Because of that, a Python 3 regression was
reintroduced and nobody noticed. Having a check job would help to
detect earlier such error.

The next step will be to make the gate voting to ensure that Python 3
regressions cannot be reintroduced anymore.

Note: The change I41764d39a1dab95df47485efa3a9ea0868d93036 should fix
"tox -e py34" in Barbican.

Partially-Implements: blueprint barbican-py3
Change-Id: I8ce646aaca97b04741649f863a744fbd389198a6
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add a non-voting gate-barbican-python34 check job

Barbican has a py34 test environment in tox.ini, but no check job
associated job. Because of that, a Python 3 regression was
reintroduced and nobody noticed. Having a check job would help to
detect earlier such error.

The next step will be to make the gate voting to ensure that Python 3
regressions cannot be reintroduced anymore.

Note: The change I41764d39a1dab95df47485efa3a9ea0868d93036 should fix
"tox -e py34" in Barbican.

Partially-Implements: blueprint barbican-py3
Change-Id: I8ce646aaca97b04741649f863a744fbd389198a6

subject: Better message about updates available
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-19 17:04:07.000000000', 'files': ['iso/bootstrap_admin_node.docker.sh'], 'message': 'Better message about updates available

Message used can easily scare off: if Fuel installs without
errors, there are should not be any warnings. We had warning
even if both installation is successful and Internet is
available for updates. I propose to change it to notice
(same type of message which is used for "Master node installation has
been completed successfully").

Change-Id: If7911f9a28d7d1d5977819a01612b051cd4e0e72
Related-Bug: #1495658
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Better message about updates available

Message used can easily scare off: if Fuel installs without
errors, there are should not be any warnings. We had warning
even if both installation is successful and Internet is
available for updates. I propose to change it to notice
(same type of message which is used for "Master node installation has
been completed successfully").

Change-Id: If7911f9a28d7d1d5977819a01612b051cd4e0e72
Related-Bug: #1495658

commit_message:
adds the config_template to galera_client

The change modifies the galera_client template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: Ia798607268d874a50e3c2f2cddbb9512d74df3ca

commit_message:
Adds more unit_tests, bug fixes for API

This change adds additional unit tests for the REST API methods
get_test_runs, get_runs_from_build_name, get_tests_from_run,
get_run_test_runs. Also fixes a typo and adds dict conversion in the
API method get_run_test_runs.

Co-Authored-By: Matthew Treinish <mtreinish@kortar.org>

commit_message:
Return NOT_RUNNING when beam is not RUNNING

Change get_status to return NOT_RUNNING when
beam is not_running. Otherwise, pacemaker
will get stuck during rabbitmq failover and
will not attempt to restart the failed resource

Change-Id: I926a3eafa9968abdf07baa5f2d5c22480300fb30
Closes-bug: #1484280

commit_message:
Just do the error logging in the base exception

We want to make an error log every time we throw an exception that
is wrapping another exception. So, just do it in the constructor.

Change-Id: Id8f1ab97d1c58787ff101ea2410fcf7c789041ed

commit_message:
Adding Functional Tests and Supporting Fixes for Global Preferred CAs

This commit containers the following changes to fix the global
preferred certificate authority operations.

- Add functional tests for global preferred CA operations
- Change cas/CA_ID/unset-global-preferred to cas/unset-global-preferred
- Allow all content types for set-global-preferred and unset-global-preferred
- Add create_or_update_from_project_id() for PreferredCertificateAuthority
  table and refactor
- Make reserved global project id an external project id
- Use hard delete for PreferredCertificateAuthority entities

Change-Id: I56fbdb0246f3159444778cd37d0080f771eb00f6
Partially-implements: blueprint add-cas
APIImpact:

commit_message:
Add auth version for legacy OpenStack clients

Adding this environment variable expands Identity v3 coverage for legacy
OpenStack CLI clients. This corrects the authentication URLs used even
if v2 is still being used.

Change-Id: I68197ffd12d71a437c482f13520b83cb08d4c9de
Closes-Bug: #1495685
(cherry-picked from commit f9ea209e12)

commit_message:
Prepare Schema Model API for the new architecture

Schema Model API used DataSourceManager class to return a schema
of datasource or its table. DatasourceManager will be removed in
the new architecture since each datasource works in each process.

This patch changes Schema Model API not to use DataSourceManager's
method.

Change-Id: I3d8e0306422ad77a58734c65dd8494f110024ff6
Partially-Implements: blueprint dist-api-rpcify-schema

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-26 23:31:25.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/client.py'], 'message': 'Support os-endpoint-type

Ceilometerclient will always get publicURL even though we specify
endpoint type via arguments, it is because we call kesytone session
with wrong keyword argument, which should be interface rather than
endpoint_type.

see: https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py

Change-Id: Ic2b03bd900d913c7efd22c9b91dfaa79e0cdd4bc
Closes-Bug: #1396493
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Support os-endpoint-type

Ceilometerclient will always get publicURL even though we specify
endpoint type via arguments, it is because we call kesytone session
with wrong keyword argument, which should be interface rather than
endpoint_type.

see: https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/auth/identity/base.py

Change-Id: Ic2b03bd900d913c7efd22c9b91dfaa79e0cdd4bc
Closes-Bug: #1396493

commit_message:
Support base64 padding in federated tokens

Fernet tokens can have base64 padding, which gets urlencoded as one
or more "%3D" strings at the end of the token. This change expands the
parsing of tokens to support the % character.

Change-Id: I62ff7bd94b475cddbc3cfcc7782ce4ef3b65b268

commit_message:
Use format_list instead of format_dict when listing images

This currently breaks listing images with --long. Tags are an
array and shouldn't be formatted as a dictionary.

Change-Id: I6d1d85351b58ae4824498774673ebdc8eaa7e420
Closes-Bug: #1498150

commit_message:
Format an images properties and tags

Currently, these properties are each top level keys, they should
all be under a single 'properties' field. Secondly, the tags are
kept as an array, but can be shown as a comma separated string.

Change-Id: Ic769c657a86e768fee38acc40434c377de70a7bc

Change I75c6581fcc9f47a68bde29cbefcaa1a2a082344e introduced
a bug where host name changes broke tunneling endpoint updates.
Tunneling endpoint updates changing roaming a hostname from IP
to IP are a common method for active/passive HA with pacemaker
and should happen automatically without the need for API calls.

delete_endpoint_by_host_or_ip is introduced to avoid race
conditions where:

1) we have hostA: ip1
2) you register hostA: ip2

if we deleted by ip1, and ip2 before updating the new hostA:ip2,
and another hostB registers with ip1 in the middle, the new hostB:ip1
would be deleted.

Change-Id: I04d08d5b82ce9911f3af555b5776fc9823e0e5b6
Closes-Bug: #1464178

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-06-23 11:51:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix hostname roaming for ml2 tunnel endpoints in HA.

Change I75c6581fcc9f47a68bde29cbefcaa1a2a082344e introduced
a bug where host name changes broke tunneling endpoint updates.
Tunneling endpoint updates changing roaming a hostname from IP
to IP are a common method for active/passive HA with pacemaker
and should happen automatically without the need for API/CLI
calls [1].

delete_endpoint_by_host_or_ip is introduced to allow cleanup of
endpoints that potentially belonged to the newly registered agent,
while preventing the race condition found when deleting ip1 & ip2
in the next situation at step 4:

1) we have hostA: ip1
2) hostA goes offline
3) hostB goes online, with ip1, and registers
4) hostA goes online, with ip2, and registers

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1381664

Change-Id: I04d08d5b82ce9911f3af555b5776fc9823e0e5b6
Closes-Bug: #1464178

commit_message:
Fix hostname roaming for ml2 tunnel endpoints.

Change I75c6581fcc9f47a68bde29cbefcaa1a2a082344e introduced
a bug where host name changes broke tunneling endpoint updates.
Tunneling endpoint updates roaming a hostname from IP to IP
are a common method for active/passive HA with pacemaker and
should happen automatically without the need for API/CLI calls [1].

delete_endpoint_by_host_or_ip is introduced to allow cleanup of
endpoints that potentially belonged to the newly registered agent,
while preventing the race condition found when deleting ip1 & ip2
in the next situation at step 4:

1) we have hostA: ip1
2) hostA goes offline
3) hostB goes online, with ip1, and registers
4) hostA goes online, with ip2, and registers

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-neutronclient/+bug/1381664

Change-Id: I04d08d5b82ce9911f3af555b5776fc9823e0e5b6
Closes-Bug: #1464178

subject: Store the inner exception when creating an OSCException
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-18 22:39:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Store the inner exception when creating an OSCException

Masking exceptions in Python is an anti-pattern.  Etc.

However, since shade uses a base class of OpenStackCloudException
for all of its exceptions (and, for the worst offenders of
generalized exception masking, simply uses that exception itself),
we can store the original exception for clients to access if needed.

This does allow client exceptions to leak out of shade to its users,
but in a very controlled manner where we can make it clear that
this should not be used for flow control, but for informational
purposes.

Change-Id: I33269743a8f62b863569130aba3cc9b5a8539aa0

Change-Id: I33269743a8f62b863569130aba3cc9b5a8539aa0

Change-Id: I33269743a8f62b863569130aba3cc9b5a8539aa0

commit_message:
Store the inner exception when creating an OSCException

Masking exceptions in Python is an anti-pattern.  Etc.

However, since shade uses a base class of OpenStackCloudException
for all of its exceptions (and, for the worst offenders of
generalized exception masking, simply uses that exception itself),
we can store the original exception for clients to access if needed.

This does allow client exceptions to leak out of shade to its users,
but in a very controlled manner where we can make it clear that
this should not be used for flow control, but for informational
purposes.

Change-Id: I33269743a8f62b863569130aba3cc9b5a8539aa0

subject: Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-21 18:04:11.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/container-server.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/object-server.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/account-server.conf.j2'], 'message': "Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock

The Swift configuration item [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path is set to
'/var/lock/swift' by openstack-ansible in the appropriate configuration
files. The playbooks also create the directory if it does not exist. If
the host is rebooted the directory '/var/lock/swift' is missing and must
be recreated.

/var/lock (/run/lock) is a tmpfs and so the directory /var/lock/swift
will not persist between reboots.

Swift attempts to create a directory in the directory specified by
recon_lock_path however it does not recursively create any missing
parent directories.

This commit changes the value of [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path to that
set by Swift, '/var/lock'. This allows it to create the directory
'/var/lock/swift-recon-object-cron'. The creation of '/var/lock/swift'
is also removed from the playbooks.

Change-Id: I714367b02c7cf961e9e0bdee4e41f9e4e105b088
Closes-bug: #1496117
(cherry picked from commit 176107aa3026ce03a09bd9a62e7a100e58d2cccc)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock

The Swift configuration item [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path is set to
'/var/lock/swift' by openstack-ansible in the appropriate configuration
files. The playbooks also create the directory if it does not exist. If
the host is rebooted the directory '/var/lock/swift' is missing and must
be recreated.

/var/lock (/run/lock) is a tmpfs and so the directory /var/lock/swift
will not persist between reboots.

Swift attempts to create a directory in the directory specified by
recon_lock_path however it does not recursively create any missing
parent directories.

This commit changes the value of [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path to that
set by Swift, '/var/lock'. This allows it to create the directory
'/var/lock/swift-recon-object-cron'. The creation of '/var/lock/swift'
is also removed from the playbooks.

Change-Id: I714367b02c7cf961e9e0bdee4e41f9e4e105b088
Closes-bug: #1496117
(cherry picked from commit 176107aa3026ce03a09bd9a62e7a100e58d2cccc)

commit_message:
Adds the config_template to cinder

The change modifies the cinder template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I463bbd3e10895dc2e7788346493f78bc46e5f26e

commit_message:
Get runs by date

Extend the runs API with start_date and stop_date parameters to
allow filtering the list of runs by date. The filter is passed
down into the db_api.

commit_message:
Allow to filter artifacts by range

This code enables filtering properties by range by providing
several parameters, that now considered as concatination,rather
than using only the latest one.

Example: /v3/artifacts/some_type/?property=gt:1&property=lt:10
Returns all the artifacts having the value of "property" greater
than 1 and less than 10.

ApiImpact
FastTrack

Closes-Bug: #1480392

Change-Id: I6fda6b0b6ee6a1da1d0eba8fa9f766e74c4e70d4

subject: Fixed version unequality artifact filtering
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2537, 'name': 'Nikhil Komawar', 'email': 'nik.komawar@gmail.com', 'username': 'nikhil-komawar'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 11391, 'name': 'Mikhail Fedosin', 'email': 'mfedosin@redhat.com', 'username': 'fedosinme'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}, {'_account_id': 16658, 'name': 'Darja Shakhray', 'email': 'damalyavkina@gmail.com', 'username': 'dshakhray'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-18 13:31:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixed version unequality artifact filtering

When filtered by the value of version field artifact list was ignoring
the filtering operators other then equality. I.e. it was possible to
list only artifacts having the version equal to some specific value, but
not the artifacts having the version less then or greater then some
value.

To implement the proper filtering a CompositeProperty comparator was
added which filters the ORM entities in the lexigraphical order of
version fields: first by version prefix, and then - if prefixes are
equal - by version suffix.

Closes-bug: #1480393
FastTrack

Change-Id: I67ae323e2b74745d794442d71b020becc494646b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-08-18 13:31:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fixed version unequality artifact filtering

When filtered by the value of version field artifact list was ignoring
the filtering operators other then equality. I.e. it was possible to
list only artifacts having the version equal to some specific value, but
not the artifacts having the version less then or greater then some
value.

To implement the proper filtering a CompositeProperty comparator was
added which filters the ORM entities in the lexigraphical order of
version fields: first by version prefix, and then - if prefixes are
equal - by version suffix.

Closes-bug: #1480393

commit_message:
Fixed version unequality artifact filtering

When filtered by the value of version field artifact list was ignoring
the filtering operators other then equality. I.e. it was possible to
list only artifacts having the version equal to some specific value, but
not the artifacts having the version less then or greater then some
value.

To implement the proper filtering a CompositeProperty comparator was
added which filters the ORM entities in the lexigraphical order of
version fields: first by version prefix, and then - if prefixes are
equal - by version suffix.

Closes-bug: #1480393
FastTrack

Change-Id: I67ae323e2b74745d794442d71b020becc494646b

commit_message:
Artifacts are now properly filtered by dict props

The ability to filter the artifacts list by the dict-based type-specific
property was broken: the code which was intended to do it was trying to
filter by 'name' property for some reason, thus returning an HTTP 500
error.

This patch fixes this issue, making sure the filtering on queries like
?property-name=key or ?property-name.key=value is working properly.

FastTrack
Closes-bug: #1479700

Change-Id: I22adf9f8a2b69dc15cf1974c00be873b90e5e0d6

subject: Pin pbr<1.8 which ignores Sphinx warnerrors
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-18 21:21:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Pin pbr<1.8 which ignores Sphinx warnerrors

By setting pbr.warnerros = True, Sphinx will fail the build on any
warnings ensuring the documentation is properly maintained.

Due to a bug in pbr 1.8.0, the setting is not recognized when using
Sphinx < 1.3.1 https://bugs.launchpad.net/pbr/+bug/1496882

Since the global-requirements.txt has Sphinx<1.3, it is hit by the bug
and that cause gates to leak Sphinx warnings in repos.

Another way would be to bump Sphinx>=1.3.1 and maybe pbr>=1.8, but that
seems to be a terrible idea.

Restrict pbr to not be above 1.8.
When the bug is fixed, pbr 1.8.0 will need to be blacklisted until
Sphinx is bumped to >=1.3.1.

Change-Id: I3e0a9b625d99d2beb117554948ea738a8fb9047b

commit_message:
Pin pbr<1.8 which ignores Sphinx warnerrors

By setting pbr.warnerros = True, Sphinx will fail the build on any
warnings ensuring the documentation is properly maintained.

Due to a bug in pbr 1.8.0, the setting is not recognized when using
Sphinx < 1.3.1 https://bugs.launchpad.net/pbr/+bug/1496882

Since the global-requirements.txt has Sphinx<1.3, it is hit by the bug
and that cause gates to leak Sphinx warnings in repos.

Another way would be to bump Sphinx>=1.3.1 and maybe pbr>=1.8, but that
seems to be a terrible idea.

Restrict pbr to not be above 1.8.
When the bug is fixed, pbr 1.8.0 will need to be blacklisted until
Sphinx is bumped to >=1.3.1.

Change-Id: I3e0a9b625d99d2beb117554948ea738a8fb9047b

commit_message:
Timebox a workaround for v2 image uploads

python-openstackclient has missing support for v2 image uploads, which
means we need to work around it here. v2 image upload support should be
an easy add though, so let's not let it linger.

Change-Id: Iad866f9c8cc122354a1071d139ac0bedc2b1d3ef

workaround that uses v1 to upload images.

commit_message:
Do not create config file for ovs2ovs patchcord

Ubuntu with OVS < 2.4 does not support such configs at all.

Change-Id: I9161e282f285dffc018a9d7d3fe91cb3760486ad
Closes-bug: #1495534

commit_message:
Use mistral plugin installation in murano integration gates

After a switch to devstack plugin, gate with murano/mistral/congress
becomes red because of mistral doesn't installed in gate.
This happened after this patch im mistral:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216729/

This patch adds plugin-style installation in murano/mistral/congress gate

Change-Id: I7cc4ab90a2dce9293fa763b9b07a3ff4039f2d8a

commit_message:
Ensure request variables have corresponding mappings

If a request variable doesn't have the proper direct mapping we
should handle the failure by raising a more detailed exception.
Otherwise when the direct mapping is being processed it will try
to match to a corresponding mappings, resulting in a generic
'IndexError'

Change-Id: I5ffdf55aea050a405cfe298a16e433a987a1c1a1
Co-Authored-By: Christopher J. Schaefer <cjschaef@us.ibm.com>
Closes-Bug: 1474660

subject: Only call isotime on datetime objects
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-31 21:27:32.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/auth/controllers.py'], 'message': "Only call isotime on datetime objects

If expires is a str then isinstance six.text_type is false and
the following exception is raised:
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'strftime'
This change explicitly checks for a datetime object, which is what
timeutils.isotime expects.

Change-Id: Ia31c80b4ae6c2dd7c2e00f69ee5ff1602edbb42d
Closes-Bug: #1490743
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Only call isotime on datetime objects

If expires is a str then isinstance six.text_type is false and
the following exception is raised:
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'strftime'
This change explicitly checks for a datetime object, which is what
timeutils.isotime expects.

Change-Id: Ia31c80b4ae6c2dd7c2e00f69ee5ff1602edbb42d
Closes-Bug: #1490743

subject: Limit libvirt Nova calls to the local compute node
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-17 02:00:16.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/libvirt.py'], 'message': 'Limit libvirt Nova calls to the local compute node

On OpenStack deployments with an excess of 1,000 provisioned
VMs, the libvirt plugin may not publish metrics for some or
all of the hosted VMs on each compute node.  This is due to
the default osapi_max_limit of 1000, limiting the number of
results from a Nova API query.

Instead of loading instance data for all Nova VMs, this change
limits the query to just VMs hosted on the local compute node.  It
assumes the hostname in agent.yaml matches the hostname in used by
Nova in OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host.

Change-Id: Id18abebc550f5bffed553248088f56d5b8a9bb63
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Limit libvirt Nova calls to the local compute node

On OpenStack deployments with an excess of 1,000 provisioned
VMs, the libvirt plugin may not publish metrics for some or
all of the hosted VMs on each compute node.  This is due to
the default osapi_max_limit of 1000, limiting the number of
results from a Nova API query.

Instead of loading instance data for all Nova VMs, this change
limits the query to just VMs hosted on the local compute node.  It
assumes the hostname in agent.yaml matches the hostname in used by
Nova in OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host.

Change-Id: Id18abebc550f5bffed553248088f56d5b8a9bb63

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-11 09:43:24.000000000', 'files': ['hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/install.d/hook-puppet.py', 'tests/software_config/test_hook_puppet.py', 'hot/software-config/elements/heat-config-puppet/README.rst'], 'message': 'Add puppet hook option for --tags

Using --tags allows you to run a puppet manifest and only apply
a subset of the catalog. You can specify --tags package for
example to only install packages resources for a given
manifest.

The intent is to use this option alongside of the TripleO docker
work to selectively control what parts of a puppet manifest
get executed in a container.

Change-Id: Ic8b54c89e62cbe5074f256e29e10f59aa2ab0aae

commit_message:
Add puppet hook option for --tags

Using --tags allows you to run a puppet manifest and only apply
a subset of the catalog. You can specify --tags package for
example to only install packages resources for a given
manifest.

The intent is to use this option alongside of the TripleO docker
work to selectively control what parts of a puppet manifest
get executed in a container.

Change-Id: Ic8b54c89e62cbe5074f256e29e10f59aa2ab0aae

commit_message:
Create Heat Domain with Keystone_domain resource

 This patch replaces the usage of Exec to create the Heat domain, by
 using the Keystone_domain resource recently implemented in
 puppet-keystone.

cherry picked from Upstream commit: 3ced80f)

Change-Id: I8cd5af772867dfe00a131b119e12800a8e2ec021
Closes-Bug: #1484066

commit_message:
Refactors utils into specific folders

Groups specific utils into more specific folders, so it is more
clear and organised.

Folders:
compute
- livemigrationutils.py
- rdpconsoleutils.py
- rdpconsoleutilsv2.py
- vmutils.py
- vmutilsv2.py

io
- ioutils.py

network
- networkutils.py
- networkutilsv2.py

storage
- basevolumeutils.py
- vhdutils.py
- vhdutilsv2.py
- volumeutils.py
- volumeutilsv2.py

The rest of the utils modules remained where they were.
Moves the module unit tests to reflect the new folder structure.
Updates all the necessary imports.

Change-Id: Ib9e67c93e0de71583fb6477bcd56f39f82eeedec

commit_message:
Revert "Set owner to root for ipsec.secrets for LibreSwan"

This reverts commit fed1a9b92778df4e65bbe03976573d2c82f94163.

Adding chown to the list of approved commands that rootwrap can run makes it trivial to SUID something and create a root shell, among other mischief.

Change-Id: I9e87a4441b01eb5239a24e971eb3474687a8f208

commit_message:
Improving node group templates validation

* Enabling node group templates update validation
  if plugin_name is not updated
* Adding check for volumes_size parameter if
  volumes_per_node is specified
* Adding ability to change plugin version without
  changing a plugin

Closes-Bug: #1494730
Partially-bug: #1494728

Change-Id: If6db35611e5b1501ca6485d0f40bb6c3b65561b8

commit_message:
Formatting and mounting methods changed for ironic

Currently only cinder volumes can be formatted and mounted.
This patch provides an ability of formatting and mounting
any attached storage devices. Also storage_paths method was
moved from node group objects to instance and corresponding
fixes in plugins was made.

Closes-bug: #1478899
Closes-bug: #1478904

Change-Id: If92d6fdea25e374d6d5c404be5ac3677cb60c057

commit_message:
Update hypervisor version

Updated hypervisor version to 8 (integer) rather than the string
value previosly ('710'). Only the major version value is reported
because conductor enforces the source host for a live migration
be less than or equal to the destination host version.  PowerVM
uses capability flags to determine if migration between hosts
is valid rather than comparing version levels.

Closes-Bug: #1498100
Change-Id: Iff53df8d933f2aff9662dee7083becab2a195510

commit_message:
Adds labels support to baymodels

Adds labels to the following:
  1. api baymodel attribute
  2. conductor template definitions and entrypoints
  3. a new column to the baymodel db
  4. objects. Note: Updates baymodel object version
  5. Tests

Partially-Implements: blueprint extend-api-network-attributes
Partially-Implements: blueprint extend-baymodel-net-attributes
Partially-Implements: blueprint conductor-template-net-update

Change-Id: I49f9c7df28f806cdedb3a382b1cb41bc48ff4e90

subject: Make pagination tolerate a deleted marker
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-20 07:08:57.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Make pagination tolerate a deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if the marker is
a deleted server. When trying to get servers with such a
marker, a "BadRequest" error saying that the marker is
not found will be raised.

We now always pass read_deleted=yes if a marker is being used.

Change-Id: I79a1fb79a38ac4006db622590574308aafdcb5b5
Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086
(cherry picked from commit 901c223f351310b38fa17aa1c3dcd758ce897e5e)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make pagination tolerate a deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if the marker is
a deleted server. When trying to get servers with such a
marker, a "BadRequest" error saying that the marker is
not found will be raised.

We now always pass read_deleted=yes if a marker is being used.

Change-Id: I79a1fb79a38ac4006db622590574308aafdcb5b5
Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086
(cherry picked from commit 901c223f351310b38fa17aa1c3dcd758ce897e5e)

commit_message:
Add if_exists arg to all update/delete commands in ovsdb/commands.py

This patch adds the optional arg if_exists=True to ovsdb commands
LSwitchSetExternalIdCommand and SetLogicalPortCommand. This is needed
to avoid raising a RuntimeError exception if a resource is being updated
after it has been deleted due to a concurrent operation.

Depends-on: I3b9f513308d90874ac8e8a7f6345697978d4920f
Change-Id: Ic7493571a944c7698bc2aa5ac92eb584842c44b4

commit_message:
Add fancy pypi version and download images

This patch adds the simple pypi based version icon/image and
download icon/image that's clickable.  This is rendered on shown
on the pypi main page for the version.  An example of what it looks
like is here:

https://pypi.python.org/pypi/oslo.concurrency

Change-Id: I4a10865145cc6f4a16f1e2ae5f9426512e461c2a

commit_message:
Consolidate kolla-build configuration in one file

The source location definition previously in build.ini was merged in
etc/kolla/kolla-build.conf since it is really configuration for the
kolla-build tool.

Change-Id: I7531af0029bdfeabbaefb8a6aa97b70bb12c021a
Closes-Bug: #1496702

commit_message:
Configure ctlplane network with a static IP

This patch updates all network configuration templates so that
we configure the ctlplane network interface with a static IP
instead of using DHCP.

The IP address used for the static IP is passed into each
nested stack network configuration template via the ControlPlaneIp
parameter.

Three new nested stack parameters called ControlPlaneSubnetCidr,
ControlPlaneDefaultRoute, and EC2MetadataIp have been added to help
configure the CIDR, default route, and EC2 metadata route on the ctlplane
statically.  These parameters can be customized via the
parameter_defaults section in the heat environment.

A single new template called net-config-static-bridge.yaml has
been added to help migrate towards using the static
configuration templates when not using network isolation.

Depends-On: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831

Change-Id: Ib267e6dcf2d5ff77f7a82ee20a123965c2d07565

commit_message:
Enable eventing from system

This change set allows for the PowerVM agents to listen to events from
the system and provision a port based off of an event in the system.

The original support to listen to ports from Neutron is still enabled.
However, the length of time that it waits is now dramatically reduced as
the system events themselves will also be considered.

Change-Id: I0d728e3f502800773cb2dc61cc6561638ecd7abe

commit_message:
Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.

It's possible for a tenant to change their router's name to something that's
not a valid hostname.  This uses a standard ak-<tenant-uuid> value that we can
rely on.

Change-Id: Id64f7c796f8ef01200f51494611458b5731149c8
Fixes-bug: #1496848
(cherry picked from commit 760df4839ef2f97a6825f852b87556569c6c03c7)

The networking-ovn devstack plugin installs the latest ovs from source

commit_message:
devstack: Remove ovs during unstack.

The networking-ovn devstack plugin installs the latest ovs from source
to get ovn installed.  This makes unstack uninstall it so it isn't
accidentally left around if someone tries to go re-install ovs from
the distro package later.

Change-Id: I66f0f3f9ab64b188fadc8d74fe16ad7e07c5e3e6
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make is so exceptions have some message

If you don't have a message on an exception it prints out as
nothing.  This change will default the messaqge to the class
name which should be useful.

Change-Id: Ie246b37c971e8c30752714b49aa55e69482b32e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-05 23:42:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add ARP spoofing protection for LinuxBridge agent

This patch adds ARP spoofing protection for the Linux Bridge
agent based on ebtables. This code was written to be minimally
invasive with the intent of back-porting to Kilo.

The protection is enabled and disabled with the same
'prevent_arp_spoofing' agent config flag added for the OVS agent
in I7c079b779245a0af6bc793564fa8a560e4226afe.

The protection works by setting up an ebtables chain for each port

commit_message:
Add ARP spoofing protection for LinuxBridge agent

This patch adds ARP spoofing protection for the Linux Bridge
agent based on ebtables. This code was written to be minimally
invasive with the intent of back-porting to Kilo.

The protection is enabled and disabled with the same
'prevent_arp_spoofing' agent config flag added for the OVS agent
in I7c079b779245a0af6bc793564fa8a560e4226afe.

The protection works by setting up an ebtables chain for each port
and jumping all ARP traffic to that chain. The port-specific chains
have a default DROP policy and then have allow rules installed that
only allow ARP traffic with a source CIDR that matches one of the
port's fixed IPs or an allowed address pair.

Since this is a back-port to Kilo, it is disabled by default just
like the protection added for OVS.

This patch additionally pulls back the required ebtables filter and
the functional test helpers to support the tests.

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/agent/linuxbridge_neutron_agent.py
	neutron/plugins/linuxbridge/common/config.py
	neutron/tests/common/machine_fixtures.py

Closes-Bug: #1274034
Change-Id: I0b0e3b1272472385dff060897ecbd25e93fd78e7
(cherry picked from commit 04197bc4bbf2bc611371060db839028c2686f87a)

[{'created': '2015-09-17 13:32:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add configurable options for HA networks

The L3 HA mechanism creates a project network for HA (VRRP) traffic
among routers. The HA project network uses the first (default) network
type in 'tenant_network_types'. Depending on the environment, this
combination may not provide a desirable path for HA traffic. For
example, some operators may prefer to use a specific network for HA
traffic to prevent split-brain issues.

This patch adds configurable options that target the network_type and
the physical_network of the created HA network.

Doc-Impact
Closes-Bug: #1481443
Change-Id: I3527a780179b5982d6e0eb0b8c32d6dafeeab730

commit_message:
Add configurable options for HA networks

The L3 HA mechanism creates a project network for HA (VRRP) traffic
among routers. The HA project network uses the first (default) network
type in 'tenant_network_types'. Depending on the environment, this
combination may not provide a desirable path for HA traffic. For
example, some operators may prefer to use a specific network for HA
traffic to prevent split-brain issues.

This patch adds configurable options that target the network_type and
the physical_network of the created HA network.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1481443
Change-Id: I3527a780179b5982d6e0eb0b8c32d6dafeeab730
(cherry picked from commit 98618644ce3c36eabfcc0aea49e7962b0506a567)
Conflicts:
	etc/neutron.conf

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-26 07:54:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure bridge exists before resuming a VM after an offline snapshot

If we take a cold snapshot of a local instance and only one instance
on the host, neutron would deleted the bridge after the instance is
paused.

Therefore, when this instance is resuming after cold snapshot is done,
it may raise an exception "libvirt error, can't get the bridge MTU".

In this patch, we re-plug the vif for the instance before resuming it.

Change-Id: I43fd09c6c36aa401b53a1af77fcb6775313797c1
Closes-Bug: #1293540

If we take a cold snapshot of a local instance and only one instance
on the host, neutron (only occurs when we use neutron linuxbridge)
would delete the bridge after the instance is paused.

Therefore, when this instance is resuming after cold snapshot is done,
it may raise an exception "libvirt error, can't get the bridge MTU".

In this patch, we re-plug the vif for the instance before resuming it.

And since nova image-create and nova shelve also involve the operation
of doing snapshot, this patch deal with them too.

Change-Id: I43fd09c6c36aa401b53a1af77fcb6775313797c1
Closes-Bug: #1293540
', 'number': 11}, {'created': '2015-03-24 00:53:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Ensure bridge exists before resuming a VM after an offline snapshot

If we take a cold snapshot of a local instance and only one instance
on the host, neutron (only occurs when we use neutron linuxbridge)
would delete the bridge after nova called the libvirt function
'managedSave'.

Therefore, when this instance is resuming after cold snapshot is done,
it may raise an exception "libvirt error, can't get the bridge MTU".

In this patch, we re-plug the vif for the instance before resuming it.

And since nova image-create and nova shelve also involve the operation
of doing snapshot, this patch deal with them too.

Change-Id: I43fd09c6c36aa401b53a1af77fcb6775313797c1

commit_message:
Ensure bridge exists before resuming a VM after an offline snapshot

If we take a cold snapshot of a local instance and only one instance
on the host, neutron (only occurs when we use neutron linuxbridge)
would delete the bridge after nova called the libvirt function
'managedSave'.

Therefore, when this instance is resuming after cold snapshot is done,
it may raise an exception "libvirt error, can't get the bridge MTU".

In this patch, we re-plug the vif for the instance before resuming it.

And since nova image-create and nova shelve also involve the operation
of doing snapshot, this patch deal with them too.

Change-Id: I43fd09c6c36aa401b53a1af77fcb6775313797c1
Closes-Bug: #1293540

commit_message:
Start using keystoneauth for keystone sessions

This is being split out from keystoneclient. That's a happymaking.
In order to make this work, we also need to fix glance image data upload
for v2 put. It seems that the internal interface has changed. Pass the file
object and not a size. We could do the work to figure out how to do it
in two discreet steps, but I believe that would involved a chunk of
engineering on a dead interface and is not worth it.

Also, Change ignore-errors to ignore_errors

Change-Id: I816752f8f4d29e40d41622bd8a271eb5c8e5a9fb

commit_message:
Change hypervisor_version to numeric value

hypervisor_version should be represented in numeric value for
comparison purpose. This is particular important during migration
since we cannot migrate from a host with hypervisor_version
higher than the destination host.

Change-Id: I440b0e1ffe9a4798c738bc4d9d1806639c8cad42
Closes-Bug: #1498100

commit_message:
adds the config_template to nova

The change modifies the nova template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I9842ed3fcb2cc4aa379a582359b1ca5d0747f714

commit_message:
adds the config_template to neutron

The change modifies the neutron template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: Ia9e4acdb86c1c61db182771658d6a175a4c45b38

Value "insecure" in swiftclient should have
inverse value of ssl_verify.

commit_message:
Adding fake plugin usage in validation ut

Currently vanilla plugin is used for validation tests
and every deprecation of vanilla plugin leads to
validation tests update. It could be avoided if fake
plugin would be used.

Change-Id: I63fe61ce35c15e699033a4a8c3bb61bd571f68de
Closes-bug: #1495944

The HDP plugin generates an operational object for provisioning

commit_message:
HDP plugin should ignore untagged configs when creating cluster_spec

The HDP plugin generates an operational object for provisioning
and managing clusters.  This object should ignore configuration
parameters that did not originate in ambari-config-resource.json
and hence have no tag value.

Change-Id: Ie6d6387a4595f7cde0ca90fdef5efff27a78a858
Closes-bug: #1496970

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-15 23:27:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add total cell/socket/core/thread counts to cpu_info

Rather than leave it up to clients to do a bunch of math to figure
out the socket/core/etc. counts based on some odd breadcrumbs, roll
up totals for all of that and present it with the cpu_info attribute.
This has the side-benefit of giving accurate counts on asymmetric
NUMA machines with no extra client effort required.

But for people that like doing that kind of thing, also include the
number of NUMA cells in the cpu_info['topology'] attribute.

Change-Id: I945f32bce96f27939d39b86af6ccec73b754f886
Closes-Bug: 1156456
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-16 22:04:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add NUMA cell count to cpu_info

Adds the number of NUMA cells from libvirt to the cpu_info['topology']
attribute, so that clients using that data for socket/core/thread
counting on hypervisors can get better-quality results.

Closes-Bug: 1156456
Change-Id: I945f32bce96f27939d39b86af6ccec73b754f886
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-09-16 22:12:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: Add NUMA cell count to cpu_info

Adds the number of NUMA cells from libvirt to the cpu_info['topology']
attribute, so that clients using that data for socket/core/thread
counting on hypervisors can get better-quality results.

Closes-Bug: 1156456
Change-Id: I945f32bce96f27939d39b86af6ccec73b754f886
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add NUMA cell count to cpu_info

Adds the number of NUMA cells from libvirt to the cpu_info['topology']
attribute, so that clients using that data for socket/core/thread
counting on hypervisors can get better-quality results.

Closes-Bug: 1156456
Change-Id: I945f32bce96f27939d39b86af6ccec73b754f886

commit_message:
Combine exit codes of the two functional test runs

The script was only returning the exit code of the second of the
two test runs.  With this change, a failure of either either run
will correctly be reported as an error.

Change-Id: I81766dee2ac141ceddf683b50a2aef11a79f968b
Closes-bug: #1488693

commit_message:
[COVERAGE] Turn off coverage

We need to fix .coveragerc and turn off coverage in one patch, since
cover.sh scrip launch check for previous patch which contain uncompatible
with coverage 4.0 option.

Also, fix for floating bug is required.

Change-Id: I4cc49c01bc5bb633f08353762f963cb4343fc6cb
Partial-Bug: #1497897

commit_message:
Cleanup some bash comparisions

Use "=" instead of "==" for normal tests to conform with POSIX,
use -z in cases it's comparison against "". Replace [[]] where
not needed with [].

Change-Id: Id40a560e3cf2faf8a14a1533c3a31f145796fd67

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-26 13:25:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py

Change-Id: I553f2e43a68577c83d890c3671380af68f9e725a

persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

	nova/compute/manager.py

commit_message:
Fix race between resource audit and cpu pinning

This fixes a race between the claimed CPUs of an instance being
persisted to the DB, and the resource audit scanning the DB for
instances and subtracting pinned CPUs from the list of available CPUs.

The problem only shows up when the following sequence happens:
1) instance A (with dedicated cpus) boots on a compute node
2) resource audit runs on that compute node
3) instance B (with dedicated cpus) boots on the same compute node

The bug is that the claimed numa topology isn't updated until
after we release COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE, so when the resource
audit retrieves the list of instances the numa_topology hasn't
been updated yet for the most recent one.

The fix is to persist the claimed numa topology before releasing
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE.

Closes-Bug: #1454451
Co-Authored-By: Dan Smith <dansmith@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 2427d288bc017a5b91430ffe16419d47703d2060)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py
	nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py

Change-Id: I553f2e43a68577c83d890c3671380af68f9e725a

commit_message:
api: add default_floating_pool parameter

default_floating_pool is an parameter used by nova api to talk to
neutron server and associate floating IP to servers from the public
network. Upstream default is 'nova', let's keep it but at least this
patch allows to change the parameter.

Change-Id: Ic060fc18c8f5d7dc8fcf1d7bd921623dc505a515

When creating Cinder::Type resources, we need to make sure Keystone

commit_message:
Make sure cinder is created before creating Cinder::Type

When creating Cinder::Type resources, we need to make sure Keystone
resources for Cinder are created, because they'll be used by
Cinder::Type to create a volume type.

This patch is useful when Cinder::Type is declared on the same node as
Cinder API & Keystone server.

Change-Id: Ia823d80a4eb384ac51d8b1711e8664a3d29247f7

commit_message:
Remove special Zanata suffix from jobs

Now that we are switched to zanata we don't need two sets of job names
to keep the transifex vs zanata split straight in JJB and Zuul. Just
condense down to translation-jobs.

Change-Id: Ic512b2f58a1c9a084f4e25fdf4761fd0c4e6ff0a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-19 22:17:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add missing X-xxxx HTTP headers to the unauth context

The unauth context is used by Barbican out of the box for local API evaluation
as well as for deployments where an authenticating proxy (such as Repose) is
placed in front of Barbican. Hence this unauth context must provide all the
required HTTP header settings to the Barbican context prior to policy engine

Closes-Bug: #1497639
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-21 04:38:06.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/api/middleware/test_context.py', 'barbican/api/middleware/context.py'], 'message': 'Add missing X-xxxx HTTP headers to the unauth context

The unauth context is used by Barbican out of the box for local API evaluation
as well as for deployments where an authenticating proxy (such as Repose) is
placed in front of Barbican. Hence this unauth context must provide all the
required HTTP header settings to the Barbican context prior to policy engine
computation for RBAC and so forth. This CR provides those missing headers.

Change-Id: Ib1d6abdb384f5883aa06ec1b6811c3ad80291568
Closes-Bug: #1497639

commit_message:
Add missing X-xxxx HTTP headers to the unauth context

The unauth context is used by Barbican out of the box for local API evaluation
as well as for deployments where an authenticating proxy (such as Repose) is
placed in front of Barbican. Hence this unauth context must provide all the
required HTTP header settings to the Barbican context prior to policy engine
computation for RBAC and so forth. This CR provides those missing headers.

Change-Id: Ib1d6abdb384f5883aa06ec1b6811c3ad80291568
Closes-Bug: #1497639

commit_message:
Use of ast for integers doesn't changes type

ast.literal_eval doesn't change types for Integer
Booleans resulting in DBAPIError exceptions with
at least postgresql. Boolean columns need to be
explicitly cast to boolean types.

Change-Id: If10be4f6748be3cad48167ba6bbf4433ce9c8abf
Closes-Bug: #1494475

commit_message:
Initialize Database Before Running Quota Enforcer Unit Tests

The database_utils.RepositoryTestCase mixin ensures that the unit
test database is initialized at the start of a test case class.

Closes-bug: #1497774

subject: Modifed http_check to init keystone clients and re-use
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-16 16:45:25.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/collector/checks_d/http_check.py'], 'message': 'Modifed http_check to init keystone clients and re-use

The previous code was initializing the keystone client each
time check was called in the case use_keystone is True.
Our default http_check config uses drop wizard checks that do
not require keystone.  This could eliminate the number of
keystone token requests for any http_checks that require
a keystone token, since now they will be cached.

Change-Id: I47827d549365c29a36846d51ede0fb06da435ac7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Modifed http_check to init keystone clients and re-use

The previous code was initializing the keystone client each
time check was called in the case use_keystone is True.
Our default http_check config uses drop wizard checks that do
not require keystone.  This could eliminate the number of
keystone token requests for any http_checks that require
a keystone token, since now they will be cached.

Change-Id: I47827d549365c29a36846d51ede0fb06da435ac7

commit_message:
Cleanup a few auth_token comments

It is not only memcached cases where revocations need to be checked,
so this cleans up an old comment that was no longer giving the full
picture on that. It also corrects a couple other nit grammatical
issues for better clarity.

commit_message:
Add password for user cirros in the guide of launch an instance

The guide of launch an instance only mentioned the user name of image
cirros which is 'cirros' and didn`t provide the password of the user
'cirros'.

commit_message:
Update tuskar to support renamed heat roles

We are dropping the -puppet from the role templates in
the puppet directory. This change updates 90-tuskar-db-sync
so that it supports either case.

Change-Id: I71cb07b2f5305aaf9c43ab175cca976e844b8175

commit_message:
Expose serial, wwn and vendor on the BlockDevice object

Currently we only use these disk properties for root device hints.
However, they'll be really useful for inspector, especially for also
implementing root device hints.

Change-Id: I48aa6b6d2d198d16f2f8e387970f7230066cf8a2

commit_message:
Remove pip install of pyscss in Horizon

Because of the correction of the dependney repos in RDO, pyscss
no longer needs to be installed via pip.

commit_message:
os-net-config: add ping_metadata_ip function

Updates os-net-config to use --detailed-exit-codes so that when
a network change has been detected we can perform a network validation
via a new ping_metadata_ip function. This function performs a simple ping
test back to the IP address of the Heat API which should always be
available after any network configuration change.

The motivation for this change is to allow network configuration
changes time to settle. When making changes to the ctlplane (which
is typically used to contact the undercloud Heat API for subsequent
configuration notifications and updates) it is sometimes desirable to
wait a few seconds before proceeding. This avoids a race where the
ctlplane was switch to a static IP address and the very next
Heat notification would sometimes fail.

Depends-On: I8f22fa15335d1276f4e444a6454a24ff486e1495

Change-Id: I257e1cba6dee16f73f75512d1284e1e3b9d4c831

subject: Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-16 12:33:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock

The Swift configuration item [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path is set to
'/var/lock/swift' by openstack-ansible in the appropriate configuration
files. The playbooks also create the directory if it does not exist. If
the host is rebooted the directory '/var/lock/swift' is missing and must
be recreated.

/var/lock (/run/lock) is a tmpfs and so the directory /var/lock/swift
will not persist between reboots.

Swift attempts to create a directory in the directory specified by
recon_lock_path however it does not recursively create any missing
parent directories.

This commit changes the value of [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path to that
set by Swift, '/var/lock'. This allows it to create the directory
'/var/lock/swift-recon-object-cron'. The creation of '/var/lock/swift'
is also removed from the playbooks.

Change-Id: I714367b02c7cf961e9e0bdee4e41f9e4e105b088
Closes-bug: #1496117
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-09-21 11:18:18.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/os_swift/tasks/swift_pre_install.yml', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/container-server.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/object-server.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/os_swift/templates/account-server.conf.j2'], 'message': "Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock

be recreated.

will not persist between reboots.

Swift attempts to create a directory in the directory specified by
recon_lock_path however it does not recursively create any missing
parent directories.

This commit changes the value of [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path to that
set by Swift, '/var/lock'. This allows it to create the directory
'/var/lock/swift-recon-object-cron'. The creation of '/var/lock/swift'
is also removed from the playbooks.

Change-Id: I714367b02c7cf961e9e0bdee4e41f9e4e105b088
Closes-bug: #1496117
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Change recon_lock_path to /var/lock

The Swift configuration item [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path is set to
'/var/lock/swift' by openstack-ansible in the appropriate configuration
files. The playbooks also create the directory if it does not exist. If
the host is rebooted the directory '/var/lock/swift' is missing and must
be recreated.

/var/lock (/run/lock) is a tmpfs and so the directory /var/lock/swift
will not persist between reboots.

Swift attempts to create a directory in the directory specified by
recon_lock_path however it does not recursively create any missing
parent directories.

This commit changes the value of [filter:recon]/recon_lock_path to that
set by Swift, '/var/lock'. This allows it to create the directory
'/var/lock/swift-recon-object-cron'. The creation of '/var/lock/swift'
is also removed from the playbooks.

Change-Id: I714367b02c7cf961e9e0bdee4e41f9e4e105b088
Closes-bug: #1496117

commit_message:
Fix catch-all event def to exclude !event

Excluding an event using event definitions
gets overriden by the catch-all event def
and doesnt get excluded by default.

This fixes the catch-all (*) event def by
adding any excluded event types to it.

Change-Id: Iee42054d6159c579c80b14268ecaf76cb3929a3c
Closes-Bug: 1460808

Enable block-scoped-var

This rule enforces C-style block scoped variables, which javascript
does not do natively.

http://eslint.org/docs/rules/block-scoped-var

commit_message:
Fix for multiple entries in ucast_mac_remote

checking mac and logical switch while creating l2-gateway-connection,
if there is entry in ucast_mac_remote for second l2-gateway-connection for
same logical switch.
taken care of deleting ucast_mac_remote and vlan_bindings
while deleting l2-gateway-connection.

Closes-Bug:1447910

Co-Authored-By: Phani Pawan <ppawan@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By: MANJUNATH PATIL <mpatil@hp.com>

Change-Id: Id9205c902210d94d7168eb95fbd6c3520fbb6239
(cherry picked from commit 5d4a4ad7904def80ef13ab0673103cf7be161716)

Fix for internal server error

internal server error occurs if empty l2gateway is passed in
_check_port_fault_status_and_switch_fault_status.so checking the the same.

Closes-Bug: 1454670

commit_message:
Remove unecessary constraint between Package and Config resource

Remove an unecessary contraint between the opencontrail neutron plugin
package and the neutron plugin config type as this constraint has been
moved directly within the type[1]

[1]
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-neutron/commit/2c21af85dac4353a6950e4cf153d9a0062dea294

Change-Id: I8d81dc48011c4cce869bbbeabf8e4c2d8ba8871e

subject: Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-17 16:14:26.000000000', 'files': ['akanda/rug/test/unit/api/test_configuration.py', 'akanda/rug/api/configuration.py'], 'message': "Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.

It's possible for a tenant to change their router's name to something that's
not a valid hostname.  This uses a standard ak-<tenant-uuid> value that we can
rely on.

Change-Id: Id64f7c796f8ef01200f51494611458b5731149c8
Fixes-bug: #1496848
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use a standard hostname to prevent setting invalid hostnames.

It's possible for a tenant to change their router's name to something that's
not a valid hostname.  This uses a standard ak-<tenant-uuid> value that we can
rely on.

Change-Id: Id64f7c796f8ef01200f51494611458b5731149c8
Fixes-bug: #1496848

commit_message:
Ensure CNAME RRSets only have one record

Throw a 400 error back at the user if they try to create a CNAME
RRSet with more than 1 record.

Change-Id: I252fcd046dc902ff28162d831c0c0fd6b0dea3d2
Closes-Bug: 1486743

commit_message:
Create Heat Domain with Keystone_domain resource

 This patch replaces the usage of Exec to create the Heat domain, by
 using the Keystone_domain resource recently implemented in
 puppet-keystone.

cherry picked from Upstream commit: 3ced80f)

Change-Id: I8cd5af772867dfe00a131b119e12800a8e2ec021
Closes-Bug: #1484066

commit_message:
adds the config_template to tempest

The change modifies the tempest template tasks such that it's now
using the config_template action plugin. This change will make so that
config files can be dynamically updated, by a deployer, at run time,
without requiring the need to modify the in tree templates or defaults.

Partially implements: blueprint tunable-openstack-configuration

Change-Id: I3b664fcec14bf01f9916ced0b8595a57d4873f79

commit_message:
Remove unused Node dependencies.

This removes several large and unnecessary node dependencies,
reducing the total space consumed by build dependencies by around
34%. In particular, `gulp-imagemin` and `debowerify` (along with
their associated build steps) are removed, freeing ~200MB.

Change-Id: Ic560d30c559ddd24f1a7089f5287ce26108de212

subject: Disable the _cleanup_incomplete_migrations() periodic task by default
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-21 14:52:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Disable the _cleanup_incomplete_migrations() periodic task by default

This patch disables the incomplete migration cleanup periodic task by
default because it will destroy data if an instance is on shared storage.
If an instance was involved in a failed migration, the task deletes the
instance storage without checking whether it is on shared storage first.
This means that it could delete the one and only copy of an instance's
data because one side of a failed migration ran this task.

Unfortunately, the original code was using an existing configuration
variable for control, to make it backportable. Thus, this patch must add
another variable to split control of the two tasks, so that the offending
one may be disabled by default.

Deployers that do not use shared storage that are concerned about the
security implications of the original bug (1392527) should re-enable
this task on their systems at a reasonable interval. Deployers that are
using shared storage SHOULD NOT ENABLE THIS, but also should  not be
affected by the aforementioned bug either.

This is considered the least amount of change we can make to mitigate
the issue at this point in the release.

DocImpact: This needs explanation for the deployers to make a proper
decision during initial configuration. It also deserves release note
material for people upgrading to this code.

Change-Id: I9f8c26cfb545a56bc5736064ec672e4d76e057d7
Partial-Bug: #1498023
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Disable the _cleanup_incomplete_migrations() periodic task by default

This patch disables the incomplete migration cleanup periodic task by
default because it will destroy data if an instance is on shared storage.
If an instance was involved in a failed migration, the task deletes the
instance storage without checking whether it is on shared storage first.
This means that it could delete the one and only copy of an instance's
data because one side of a failed migration ran this task.

Unfortunately, the original code was using an existing configuration
variable for control, to make it backportable. Thus, this patch must add
another variable to split control of the two tasks, so that the offending
one may be disabled by default.

Deployers that do not use shared storage that are concerned about the
security implications of the original bug (1392527) should re-enable
this task on their systems at a reasonable interval. Deployers that are
using shared storage SHOULD NOT ENABLE THIS, but also should  not be
affected by the aforementioned bug either.

This is considered the least amount of change we can make to mitigate
the issue at this point in the release.

DocImpact: This needs explanation for the deployers to make a proper
decision during initial configuration. It also deserves release note
material for people upgrading to this code.

Change-Id: I9f8c26cfb545a56bc5736064ec672e4d76e057d7
Partial-Bug: #1498023

commit_message:
Remove POSIX file modes.

This patch removes File resources, which should be delivered by packaging
tools. These resources (files and directories with attributes) could be in
conflict with different OS packaging systems, which isn't a desired result.

Change-Id: Ife7d6b061380ea5ddcdf581c22e0fa6b1d31da61
Closes-bug: #1458915

commit_message:
Refactor agent {prepare,tear_down}_cleaning into deploy_utils

This commit refactors code from AgentDeploy.prepare_cleaning and
AgentDeploy.tear_down_cleaning into a common place so that it
can be reused for ISCSIDeploy. It also moves the method
agent.build_agent_options to deploy_utils module.

The following CONF options have been deprecated and renamed:
[agent]agent_erase_devices_priority => [deploy]erase_devices_priority
[agent]agent_erase_devices_iterations => [deploy]erase_devices_iterations

The old CONF options will be removed in the Mitaka release.

Change-Id: I818c9f81f5469bf5029495dc9b65259718c41cd5
Implements: blueprint iscsi-deploy-in-band-cleaning

commit_message:
Rely on autorequire for config resource ordering

Currently we specify the ordering of config resources wherever it is
necessary based on the presence of the file it will write to, or the
presence of the package in charge of providing the file it will write
to.

Those kind of ordering can be specified directly at the resource level
using the autorequire mechanism. With this patch, any config resource
will make sure the package in charge of providing the file will be
installed first.

Change-Id: I73285227e9bbd0c895d9f74bab9e9bb65acaba40
